intro: Oxydectes denticulata, commonly known as the toothed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and toothed, giving it its scientific name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and drought tolerance.
